chrome.notes: Chrome accepts alternate synonyms to its values: padding, border, and content.

chrome_android.notes: Chrome accepts alternate synonyms to its values: padding, border, and content.

edge.notes: Since Edge 79, accepts alternate synonyms to its values: padding, border, and content.

ie.notes: In IE 7 and IE 8 of Internet Explorer, this property always behaved like background-clip: padding when overflow was hidden, auto, or scroll.

opera.notes: Opera accepts alternate synonyms to its values: padding, border, and content.

opera_android.notes: Opera accepts alternate synonyms to its values: padding, border, and content.

safari.notes: Safari accepts alternate synonyms to its values: padding, border, and content.

safari_ios.notes: Safari accepts alternate synonyms to its values: padding, border, and content.

samsunginternet_android.notes: Samsung Internet accepts alternate synonyms to its values: padding, border, and content.

webview_android.notes: WebView accepts alternate synonyms to its values: padding, border, and content.

ie.notes: In IE 7 and IE 9 of Internet Explorer, it always behaved like background-clip: padding if overflow: hidden | auto | scroll
